benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Add custom fields to account

covered: Valid Payload: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC13, TC14, TC19 (security), TC29 (edge max/min values) show successful creation with valid payloads and boundary cases.
Invalid Payload: TC08 (malformed JSON), TC09 (empty body), TC07 (missing required header), TC06 (invalid accountId format) cover malformed/missing/invalid inputs.
Authorization: TC16 (unauthorized access) lacks valid authentication to trigger 401.
Edge Cases and Validation: TC11 (unsupported fields), TC12 (duplicate field names), TC28 (invalid data types), TC30 (null values handling) cover input validation and edge scenarios.
Boundary/Large Payload: TC14 (maximum payload) and TC15 (payload too large) cover payload size boundaries.
Regression: TC23, TC24 cover backward compatibility and previously fixed issues.
gaps: Concurrency/Race Conditions: Only partial recovery scenario (TC20) exists; broader concurrency tests during concurrent posts are not deeply covered.
Rate Limiting: No tests addressing rate-limiting or throttling under load.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related semantics.
Duplicate Submission Handling: Not explicit coverage for idempotent/duplicate POST submissions (same payload sent twice).
Pagination: Not relevant for POST, but no explicit guidance on large multi-part payload handling beyond size tests; still no explicit large dataset handling in terms of streaming or chunking.
recommendations: Add explicit tests for rate limiting/throttling behavior on repeated POSTs to the same endpoint.
Introduce tests for authentication/authorization nuances (e.g., 403 vs 401, token expiry) beyond TC16, to ensure proper authorization handling.
Add caching-related tests (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST endpoints if applicable, to verify caching semantics.
Add a dedicated test for idempotency/duplicate POST submissions to ensure system handles duplicates gracefully (e.g., 409 or 200 with no duplicates created).
Enhance concurrency coverage with at least one explicit race-condition scenario (multiple clients posting simultaneously to ensure data integrity).
Document and test pagination-related considerations even if POST typically doesn’t paginate; ensure no implicit pagination side-effects with large batch submissions, if applicable.
